ai-sn48:6.1.4_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly understand the gratification, drawback, and escape when it comes to these five faculties.

ai-sn48:7.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are ascetics and brahmins who don’t understand the faculty of faith, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.
ai-sn48:7.1.2_0: They don’t understand the faculty of energy ...
ai-sn48:7.1.5_0: wisdom, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.
ai-sn48:7.1.6_0: I don’t regard them as true ascetics and brahmins. Those venerables don’t realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and don’t live having realized it with their own insight.
ai-sn48:7.2.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who do understand the faculty of faith, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.
ai-sn48:7.2.2_0: They do understand the faculty of energy ...
ai-sn48:7.2.5_0: wisdom, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.
ai-sn48:7.2.6_0: I regard them as true ascetics and brahmins. Those venerables realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and live having realized it with their own insight.”
ai-sn48:8.1.3_0: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:8.1.4_0: And where should the faculty of faith be seen?
ai-sn48:8.1.5_0: In the four factors of stream-entry.
ai-sn48:8.1.6_0: He should see the faculty of faith here.
ai-sn48:8.1.7_0: And where should the faculty of energy be seen?
ai-sn48:8.1.9_0: Herein, the faculty of energy should be seen here.
ai-sn48:8.1.10_0: And where should the faculty of mindfulness be seen?
ai-sn48:8.1.11_0: In the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-sn48:8.1.12_0: There the faculty should be seen here.
ai-sn48:8.1.13_0: And where should the faculty of immersion be seen?
ai-sn48:8.1.15_0: Herein, concentration should be seen here.
ai-sn48:8.1.16_0: And where should the faculty of wisdom be seen?
ai-sn48:8.1.18_0: Herein, the wisdom should be seen here.
ai-sn48:9.1.3_0: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:9.1.4_0: And what is the faculty of faith?
ai-sn48:9.1.5_0: It’s when a noble disciple has faith in the Realized One’s awakening ...
ai-sn48:9.1.6_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-sn48:9.1.7_0: This, monastics, is called the faith faculty.
ai-sn48:9.2.1_0: And what is the faculty of energy?
ai-sn48:9.2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant lives with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities. They’re strong, staunchly vigorous, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities.
ai-sn48:9.2.3_0: This is called the faculty of energy.
ai-sn48:9.3.1_0: And what is the faculty of mindfulness?
ai-sn48:9.3.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple is mindful. They have utmost mindfulness and alertness, and can remember and recall what was said and done long ago.
ai-sn48:9.3.3_0: This is called the faculty of mindfulness.
ai-sn48:9.4.1_0: And what is the faculty of immersion?
ai-sn48:9.4.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple, relying on letting go, gains immersion, gains unification of mind.
ai-sn48:9.4.3_0: This, monks, is called the Faculty of Concentration.
ai-sn48:9.5.1_0: And what, monks, is the Faculty of Wisdom?
ai-sn48:9.5.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple is wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-sn48:9.5.3_0: This, monks, is called the Faculty of Wisdom.
ai-sn48:10.1.3_0: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:10.1.4_0: And what is the faculty of faith?
ai-sn48:10.1.5_0: It’s when a noble disciple has faith in the Realized One’s awakening ...
ai-sn48:10.1.6_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-sn48:10.1.7_0: This, monastics, is called the faith faculty.
ai-sn48:10.2.1_0: And what is the faculty of energy?
ai-sn48:10.2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant lives with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities. They’re strong, staunchly vigorous, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities.
ai-sn48:10.2.3_0: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that bad, unskillful qualities don’t arise.
ai-sn48:10.2.4_0: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that bad, unskillful qualities that have arisen are given up.
ai-sn48:10.2.5_0: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that skillful qualities that have not arisen do arise.
ai-sn48:10.2.6_0: so that skillful qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are completed by development.
ai-sn48:10.2.7_0: This is called the faculty of energy.
ai-sn48:10.3.1_0: And what is the faculty of mindfulness?
ai-sn48:10.3.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple is mindful. They have utmost mindfulness and alertness, and can remember and recall what was said and done long ago.
ai-sn48:10.3.3_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn48:10.3.5_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind ...
ai-sn48:10.3.6_0: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn48:10.3.7_0: This is called the faculty of mindfulness.
ai-sn48:10.4.1_0: And what is the faculty of immersion?
ai-sn48:10.4.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple, relying on letting go, gains immersion, gains unification of mind.
ai-sn48:10.4.3_0: Quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, they enter and remain in the first absorption ...
ai-sn48:10.4.4_0: As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, they enter and remain in the second absorption ...
ai-sn48:10.4.5_0: And with the fading away of rapture, they enter and remain in the third absorption, where they meditate with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss.’
ai-sn48:10.4.6_0: Giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, they enter and remain in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-sn48:10.4.7_0: This, monks, is called the Faculty of Concentration.
ai-sn48:10.5.1_0: And what, monks, is the Faculty of Wisdom?
ai-sn48:10.5.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple is wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-sn48:10.5.3_0: But they truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ ...
ai-sn48:10.5.4_0: This, monks, is called the Faculty of Wisdom.
ai-sn48:10.5.7_0: The first sub-chapter on bare grounds is finished.

ai-sn48:11.3.1_0: And what is the faculty of mindfulness?

ai-sn48:11.5.3_0: This, monks, is called the Faculty of Wisdom.
ai-sn48:12.1.3_0: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:12.1.4_0: These, monastics, are the five faculties.
ai-sn48:12.1.5_0: Someone who has completed and fulfilled these five faculties is a perfected one. If they are weaker than that, they’re a non-returner. If they are weaker still, they’re a once-returner. If they are weaker still, they’re a stream-enterer. If they’re weaker still, they’re a follower of the teachings. If they’re weaker still, they’re a follower by faith.”
ai-sn48:13.1.3_0: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:13.1.4_0: These, monastics, are the five faculties.

ai-sn48:13.1.6_0: So from a diversity of faculties there’s a diversity of fruits. And from a diversity of fruits there’s a diversity of persons.”
ai-sn48:14.1.3_0: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:14.1.4_0: These, monastics, are the five faculties.

ai-sn48:14.1.6_0: So, mendicants, if you practice partially you succeed partially. If you practice fully you succeed fully.

If they are weaker than that, they’re practicing to realize the fruit of perfection ... a non-returner ... practicing to realize the fruit of non-return ... a once-returner ... practicing to realize the fruit of once-return ... a stream-enterer ... practicing to realize the fruit of stream-entry.
ai-sn48:18.1.6_0: Someone who totally and utterly lacks these five faculties is an outsider who belongs with the ordinary persons, I say.”
ai-sn48:19.1.1_0: Then a certain monk went to the Fortunate One,
ai-sn48:19.2.1_0: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘the faculties’.
ai-sn48:19.2.2_0: How is someone accomplished regarding the faculties defined?”
ai-sn48:19.2.3_0: “Mendicant, it’s when a mendicant develops the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom that lead to peace and awakening.
ai-sn48:19.2.4_0: That’s how a mendicant is accomplished in the faculties.”
ai-sn48:20.1.3_0: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:20.1.4_0: These, monastics, are the five faculties.
ai-sn48:20.1.5_0: It’s because of developing and cultivating these five faculties that a mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.”
ai-sn48:20.1.7_0: The second sub-chapter on lying down is finished.
ai-sn48:20.2.2_0: Another three more than three others in full.
ai-sn48:20.2.4_0: the tenth part of the night is produced.
ai-sn48:21.1.3_0: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:21.1.4_0: As long as I didn’t truly understand these five faculties’ gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
ai-sn48:21.1.5_0: But when I did truly understand these five faculties’ gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, I announced my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
ai-sn48:21.1.6_0: To me knowledge and insight arose:
ai-sn48:21.1.7_0: ‘My freedom is unshakable; this is my last rebirth; now there’ll be no more future lives.’”
ai-sn48:22.1.3_0: The faculties of femininity, masculinity, and life.
ai-sn48:23.1.3_0: The faculty of understanding that one’s enlightenment is imminent, the faculty of enlightenment, and the faculty of one who is enlightened.
ai-sn48:24.1.3_0: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

If they are weaker than that, they’re one who is extinguished between one life and the next ... one who is extinguished upon landing ... one who is extinguished without extra effort ... one who is extinguished with extra effort ... one who heads upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm ... a once-returner ... a one-seeder ... one who goes from family to family ... one who has seven rebirths at most ... a follower of the teachings ... a follower by faith.”

ai-sn48:36.2.1_0: And what is the faculty of pleasure?
ai-sn48:36.2.2_0: Physical enjoyment, physical pleasure, the enjoyable, pleasant feeling that’s born from physical contact.
ai-sn48:36.2.3_0: This is called the faculty of pleasure.
ai-sn48:36.3.1_0: And what is the faculty of pain?
ai-sn48:36.3.2_0: Physical pain, physical displeasure, the painful, unpleasant feeling that’s born from physical contact.

ai-sn48:42.1.2_0: Then Uṇṇābha the brahmin went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-sn48:42.1.3_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-sn48:42.1.3_1: Then he said to the Buddha,
ai-sn48:42.2.1_0: “Master Gotama, these five faculties have different scopes and different ranges, and don’t experience each others’ scope and range.
ai-sn48:42.2.3_0: eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.
ai-sn48:42.2.4_0: What do these five faculties, with their different scopes and ranges, have recourse to? What experiences their scopes and ranges?”
ai-sn48:42.3.1_0: “Brahmin, these five faculties have different scopes and different ranges, and don’t experience each others’ scope and range.
ai-sn48:42.3.3_0: eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.
ai-sn48:42.3.4_0: These five faculties, with their different scopes and ranges, have recourse to the mind. And the mind experiences their scopes and ranges.”
ai-sn48:42.4.1_0: “But what does the mind have recourse to?”
ai-sn48:42.4.3_0: “But what does mindfulness have recourse to?”
ai-sn48:42.4.5_0: “But what does freedom have recourse to?”
ai-sn48:42.4.7_0: “But what does extinguishment have recourse to?”
ai-sn48:42.4.8_0: “This question goes too far, brahmin! You weren’t able to grasp the limit of questioning.
ai-sn48:42.4.9_0: For extinguishment is the culmination, destination, and end of the spiritual life.”
ai-sn48:42.5.1_0: And then, Uṇṇābha approved and agreed with what the Buddha said. He got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.
ai-sn48:42.6.1_0: Then, not long after he had left, the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
ai-sn48:42.6.2_0: “Suppose there was a bungalow or a hall with a peaked roof, with windows on the eastern side. When the sun rises and a ray of light enters through a window, where would it land?”
ai-sn48:42.6.4_0: “In the same way, Uṇṇābha, Streams, the Realized One has strong roots, stems, and cannot be shifted by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.
ai-sn48:42.6.5_0: If he were to pass away at this time, he would be bound by no fetter that might return him to this world.”
ai-sn48:43.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāketa in the deer part at the Añjana Wood.
ai-sn48:43.1.4_0: “Mendicants, is there a way in which the five faculties become the five powers, and the five powers become the five faculties?”
ai-sn48:43.2.1_0: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha.
ai-sn48:43.2.1_1: He is our guide and our refuge.
ai-sn48:43.2.1_2: Sir, may the Buddha himself please clarify the meaning of this. The mendicants will listen and remember it.”
ai-sn48:43.3.1_0: “Mendicants, there is a way in which the five faculties become the five powers, and the five powers become the five faculties.
ai-sn48:43.4.2_0: The faculty of faith is the power of faith, and the power of faith is the faculty of faith.
ai-sn48:43.4.3_0: The faculty of energy is the power of energy, and the power of energy is the faculty of energy.
ai-sn48:43.4.4_0: The faculty of mindfulness is the power of mindfulness, and the power of mindfulness is the faculty of mindfulness.
ai-sn48:43.4.5_0: The faculty of immersion is the power of immersion, and the power of immersion is the faculty of immersion.
ai-sn48:43.4.6_0: The faculty of wisdom is the power of wisdom, and the power of wisdom is the faculty of wisdom.
ai-sn48:43.4.7_0: Suppose that there was a river slanting, sloping, and inclining to the east, and in the middle was an island.
ai-sn48:43.4.8_0: There is a way in which that river can be reckoned to have just one stream.
ai-sn48:43.4.9_0: But there’s also a way in which that river can be reckoned to have two streams.
ai-sn48:43.5.1_0: And what’s the way in which that river can be reckoned to have just one stream?
ai-sn48:43.5.2_0: By taking into account the water to that lamp, the waters of the island
ai-sn48:43.5.3_0: This is the way in which that river can be reckoned to have just one stream.
ai-sn48:43.6.1_0: And what’s the way in which that river can be reckoned to have two streams?
ai-sn48:43.6.2_0: By taking into account the water to the north and the south of the island,
ai-sn48:43.6.3_0: This is the way in which that river can be reckoned to have two streams.
ai-sn48:43.6.4_0: In the same way, the faculty of faith is the power of faith, and the power of faith is the faculty of faith.
ai-sn48:43.6.5_0: The faculty of energy is the power of energy, and the power of energy is the faculty of energy.
ai-sn48:43.6.6_0: The faculty of mindfulness is the power of mindfulness, and the power of mindfulness is the faculty of mindfulness.
ai-sn48:43.6.7_0: The faculty of immersion is the power of immersion, and the power of immersion is the faculty of immersion.
ai-sn48:43.6.8_0: The faculty of wisdom is the power of wisdom, and the power of wisdom is the faculty of wisdom.
ai-sn48:43.6.9_0: It’s because of developing and cultivating the five faculties that a mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.”

ai-sn48:49.1.4_0: “I understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn48:49.1.5_0: Then many monks went to the Fortunate One,
ai-sn48:49.1.5_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-sn48:49.2.1_0: “Sir, Venerable Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja has declared enlightenment:
ai-sn48:49.2.2_0: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’
ai-sn48:49.2.3_0: “What reason does Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja see for doing this?”
ai-sn48:49.2.4_0: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence”’?”
ai-sn48:49.3.1_0: “It’s because Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja has developed and cultivated three faculties that he declares enlightenment:
ai-sn48:49.3.2_0: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’
ai-sn48:49.3.4_0: The faculties of mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:49.3.5_0: It’s because Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja has developed and cultivated these three faculties that he declares enlightenment.
ai-sn48:49.3.6_0: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’
ai-sn48:49.3.7_0: What’s the culmination of these three faculties?
ai-sn48:49.3.11_0: It’s because he sees that they culminate in the ending of rebirth, old age, and death that Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja declares enlightenment:
ai-sn48:49.3.12_0: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence”’?”
ai-sn48:50.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Aṅgas, near the town of Āpaṇa.
ai-sn48:50.1.3_0: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-sn48:50.1.4_0: “Sāriputta, a noble disciple who is sure and devoted to the Realized One would have no doubt or uncertainty about the Realized One or his instructions.”
ai-sn48:50.2.1_0: “Sir, a noble disciple who is sure and devoted to the Realized One would have no doubt or uncertainty about the Realized One or his instructions.
ai-sn48:50.2.2_0: You can expect that a noble disciple who is energetic ...
ai-sn48:50.2.3_0: For their energy is the faculty of energy.
ai-sn48:50.3.1_0: You can expect that a faithful and energetic noble disciple will be mindful, with utmost mindfulness and alertness, able to remember and recall what was said and done long ago.
ai-sn48:50.3.2_0: For their mindfulness is the faculty of mindfulness.
ai-sn48:50.4.1_0: For a faithful noble disciple will expect to substantively gain immersion.
ai-sn48:50.4.2_0: For their samādhi is the faculty of immersion.
ai-sn48:50.5.1_0: A faithful noble disciple will expect this:
ai-sn48:50.5.3_0: No first point is found of sentient beings roaming and transmigrating, hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving.
ai-sn48:50.5.4_0: But when that dark mass of ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, that state is peaceful and sublime.
ai-sn48:50.5.5_0: That is, the stilling of all activities, the letting go of all attachments, the ending of craving, fading away, cessation, extinguishment.’
ai-sn48:50.5.6_0: For their noble wisdom is the faculty of wisdom.
ai-sn48:50.6.1_0: When a noble disciple has tried again and again, recollected again and again, entered immersion again and again, and understood with wisdom again and again, they will be confident of this:
ai-sn48:50.6.2_0: ‘I have previously heard of these things.
ai-sn48:50.6.3_0: But now I have direct meditative experience of them, and see them with penetrating wisdom.’
ai-sn48:50.6.4_0: For their faith is the faculty of faith.”
ai-sn48:50.7.2_0: “Sāriputta, a noble disciple who is sure and devoted to the Realized One would have no doubt or uncertainty about the Realized One or his instructions. ...”

ai-sn48:51.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Kosalans near Sālā.
ai-sn48:51.1.4_0: “Mendicants, the lion, king of beasts, is said to be the best of animals in terms of strength, speed, and courage.
ai-sn48:51.1.5_0: In the same way, the faculty of wisdom is said to be the best of the qualities that lead to awakening in terms of becoming awakened.
ai-sn48:51.2.1_0: And what are the things that lead to awakening?
ai-sn48:51.2.6_0: and wisdom are qualities that lead to awakening, in that they lead to becoming awakened.
ai-sn48:51.2.7_0: Of all the animals, the king of beasts, is said to be the best of animals in terms of strength, speed, and courage.
ai-sn48:51.2.8_0: In the same way, the faculty of wisdom is said to be the best of the qualities that lead to awakening in terms of becoming awakened.”
ai-sn48:52.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Mallas, near the Mallian town called Uruvelakappa.
ai-sn48:52.1.4_0: “Mendicants, as long as noble knowledge hasn’t arisen for a noble disciple the four faculties are not stable and fixed.
ai-sn48:52.1.5_0: But when noble knowledge has arisen for a noble disciple the four faculties become stable and fixed.
ai-sn48:52.2.1_0: It’s just like in a bungalow. As long as the roof peak is not lifted into place, the rafters are not stable or fixed.
ai-sn48:52.2.2_0: But when the roof peak is lifted into place, the rafters become stable and fixed.
ai-sn48:52.2.3_0: In the same way, as long as noble knowledge hasn’t arisen for a noble disciple the four faculties are not stable and fixed.
ai-sn48:52.2.4_0: But when noble knowledge has arisen for a noble disciple ...
ai-sn48:52.3.2_0: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, and immersion.
ai-sn48:52.3.3_0: When an educated noble disciple has faith, energy, and mindfulness that follow along with that become stabilized.”
ai-sn48:53.1.2_0: at one time the Fortunate One was dwelling near Kosambī, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
ai-sn48:53.1.4_0: “Mendicants, is there a way that a mendicant who is a trainee, standing at the level of a trainee, can understand that they are a trainee? And that a mendicant who is an adept, standing at the level of an adept, can understand that they are an adept?”
ai-sn48:53.2.1_0: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. ...
ai-sn48:53.2.2_0: “There is a way that a mendicant who is a trainee, standing at the level of a trainee, can understand that they are a trainee, and that a mendicant who is an adept, standing at the level of an adept, can understand that they are an adept.
ai-sn48:53.3.1_0: And what is that way that a mendicant who is a trainee can understand that they are a trainee?
ai-sn48:53.3.2_0: It’s when a mendicant who is a trainee truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ ... ‘This is the origin of suffering’ ... ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-sn48:53.3.3_0: This is a way that a mendicant who is a trainee can understand that they are a trainee.
ai-sn48:53.4.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant who is a trainee reflects:
ai-sn48:53.4.2_0: ‘Is there any other ascetic or brahmin elsewhere whose teaching is as true, as real, as accurate as that of the Buddha?’
ai-sn48:53.4.4_0: ‘There is no other ascetic or brahmin elsewhere whose teaching is as true, as real, as accurate as that of the Buddha.’
ai-sn48:53.4.5_0: This is a way that a mendicant who is a trainee can understand that they are a trainee.
ai-sn48:53.5.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant who is a trainee understands the five faculties:
ai-sn48:53.5.2_0: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:53.5.3_0: And although they don’t have direct meditative experience of their destination, apex, fruit, and culmination,
ai-sn48:53.5.4_0: they do see them with penetrating wisdom.
ai-sn48:53.5.5_0: This is a way that a mendicant who is a trainee can understand that they are a trainee.
ai-sn48:53.6.1_0: And what is that way that a mendicant who is an adept can understand that they are an adept?
ai-sn48:53.6.2_0: It’s when a mendicant who is an adept understands the five faculties:
ai-sn48:53.6.3_0: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:53.6.4_0: And although they have direct meditative experience of their destination, apex, fruit, and culmination,
ai-sn48:53.6.5_0: they do see them with penetrating wisdom.
ai-sn48:53.6.6_0: This is a way that a mendicant who is an adept can understand that they are an adept.
ai-sn48:53.7.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant who is an adept understands the six faculties:
ai-sn48:53.7.2_0: eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
ai-sn48:53.7.3_0: These six faculties of all included in every way. They understand that all the faculties will not arise. And when excellent they will not arise.’
ai-sn48:53.7.4_0: This too is a way that a mendicant who is an adept can understand that they are an adept.”

ai-sn48:56.1.5_0: It’s when a mendicant looks after their mind when it comes to defilements and things that stimulate defilements.

ai-sn48:57.1.1_0: At one time, when he was first awakened, the Buddha was staying near Uruvelā at the goatherd’s banyan tree on the bank of the Nerañjarā River.
ai-sn48:57.1.2_0: Then as the Buddha was in private retreat this thought came to his mind,
ai-sn48:57.1.3_0: “When these five faculties are developed and cultivated they culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.
ai-sn48:57.1.5_0: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:57.1.10_0: When these five faculties are developed and cultivated they culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.”
ai-sn48:57.2.1_0: Then Brahmā Sahampati knew what the Buddha was thinking. As easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, he vanished from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared in front of the Buddha.
ai-sn48:57.2.1_1: so did he vanish from the Brahmā world and appear in front of the Fortunate One.
ai-sn48:57.2.2_0: He arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha, and said:
ai-sn48:57.2.3_0: “That’s so true, Blessed One! That’s so true, Holy One!
ai-sn48:57.2.4_0: When these five faculties are developed and cultivated they culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.
ai-sn48:57.2.6_0: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:57.2.7_0: When these five faculties are developed and cultivated they culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.
ai-sn48:57.3.1_0: Once upon a time, sir, I lived the spiritual life under the fully awakened Buddha Kassapa.
ai-sn48:57.3.4_0: Because of developing and cultivating these same five faculties I lost desire for sensual pleasures. When my body broke up, after death, I was reborn in a good place, in the Brahmā realm.
ai-sn48:57.3.7_0: That’s so true, Blessed One! That’s so true, Holy One!
ai-sn48:57.3.8_0: I know and see how when these five faculties are developed and cultivated they culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.”
ai-sn48:58.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain in the Boar’s Cave.
ai-sn48:58.1.2_0: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-sn48:58.1.3_0: “Sāriputta, considering what benefit does a mendicant with defilements ended, while still alive, continue to show utmost devotion for the Realized One or his instructions?”
ai-sn48:58.1.4_0: “Sir, it is considering the supreme sanctuary that a mendicant with defilements ended, while still alive, continues to show utmost devotion for the Realized One or his instructions.”
ai-sn48:58.1.6_0: For it is considering the supreme sanctuary that a mendicant whose defilements are ended, while still alive, continues to show utmost devotion for the Realized One or his instructions.
ai-sn48:58.2.1_0: And what is that supreme sanctuary?”
ai-sn48:58.2.2_0: “It’s when a mendicant with defilements ended develops the faculties of faith,
ai-sn48:58.2.3_0: They develop the faculty of energy ...
ai-sn48:58.2.6_0: and wisdom, which lead to peace and awakening.
ai-sn48:58.2.7_0: It is considering this supreme sanctuary that a mendicant with defilements ended, while still alive, continues to show utmost devotion for the Realized One or his instructions.”
ai-sn48:58.2.9_0: For this is that supreme sanctuary.
ai-sn48:58.3.1_0: And what is that utmost devotion that a mendicant with defilements ended, while still alive, continues to show towards the Realized One or his instructions?”
ai-sn48:58.3.2_0: “Sir, it’s when a mendicant with defilements ended is respectful and reverence for the Teacher, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.
ai-sn48:58.3.5_0: For this is that utmost devotion that a mendicant with defilements ended, while still alive, continues to show towards the Realized One or his instructions.”
ai-sn48:59.1.2_0: “Mendicants, these five faculties don’t arise to be developed and cultivated except when a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha has appeared.
ai-sn48:59.1.4_0: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:59.1.5_0: These five faculties don’t arise to be developed and cultivated except when a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha has appeared.”
ai-sn48:60.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five faculties don’t arise to be developed and cultivated apart from the Holy One’s training.
ai-sn48:60.1.3_0: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-sn48:60.1.4_0: These five faculties don’t arise to be developed and cultivated apart from the Holy One’s training.”
